java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: URL contains encoded special chars.
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.RequestUtil.URLDecode(RequestUtil.java:317)
	at ContextAdmin.getContextInfo(ContextAdmin.java:76)

The source file with the problem is /webapps/admin/WEB-
INF/classes/ContextAdmin.java. The file names of the working directories 
contain "%2F" which causes URLDecode() to throw an exception. The default admin 
working directory on my Linux system is "/usr/local/tomcat/work/localhost_8080%
2Fadmin".

Duplicating the problem is easy. 1. Setup tomcat. 2. Add a user to /conf/tomcat-
users.xml with roles="admin" 3. Change the admin context to be trusted 
in /conf/server.xml 4. Browse to 
http://localhost/admin/contextAdmin/contextAdmin.html 5. Select the "View all 
Contexts" button. You should get the error.

A simple dirty hack to get rid of the error is to comment out lines 75-76 and 
remove the call to RequestUtil.URLDecode() on line 92. After those changes the 
error is gone and ContextAdmin.java will no longer throw the exception.

To fix the problem for real, maybe the file names of the working diretories 
should be changed to something less messy???? Or maybe URLDecode() shouldn't be 
used here???
